paper_abstract: Let {X, X-n; n >= 1} be a sequence of i.i.d. random variables taking values in a real separable Hilbert space (H, parallel to - parallel to) with mean zero and covariance Sigma and set S-n = Sigma(n)(k=1) X-k, n >= 1. Let sigma(2)(i) i >= 1 be the eigenvalues of Sigma arranged in non-increasing order and take into account the multiplicities. Let l be the dimension of the corresponding eigenspace of largest eigenvalue sigma(2) = or sigma(2)(1). Let log x = ln(x boolean OR e), x >= 0. This paper studies the precise rates for Sigma(infinity)(n=1) (log n)(b)/n(3/2) is an element of {parallel to S-n parallel to - sigma epsilon root 2n log log n}(+). We show that when l > 1 and b > -1, is an element of(log parallel to X parallel to(3b+3)/log log parallel to X parallel to) < infinity implies lim(epsilon SE arrow root 1+b) (1 - 1+b/epsilon(2))l(-1/2) (infinity)Sigma(n=1) (log n)(b)/n(3/2) is an element of{parallel to S-n parallel to - sigma epsilon root 2n log log n}(+) = 1/root 2(b+1) Gamma(-1) (l/2)K'(Sigma)Gamma((l-1)/2), where Gamma(.) is the Gamma function and K'(Sigma) = Pi(infinity)(i=l+1) ((sigma 2 - sigma(2)(i))/sigma(4))(-1/2). paper_title: On the moment convergence rates of LIL in Hilbert space
